personal_story: Rejected for permanent residency because the website of his volunteer organization was in English. Fought the decision and founded this network.
Green energy expert who could not move back to Denmark with his wife and three Danish kids because he did high school in the U.S.
Unsure if her American husband, a very successful musician, will be allowed to stay in the country because he can't learn Danish due to his medical condition.
Rejected for permanent residency because her volunteer work helping survivors of sexual violence was not deemed "Danish" enough.
Life sciences investor and mother to two Danish kids worried about ability to claim permanent residency if she were to change jobs.
Schoolteacher born and raised in Denmark, as part of a Somali refugee familly. Could not get citizenship until his late twenties due to the restrictive rules.
Rejected for permanent residency due to a clerical misunderstanding at the end of high school and won't be eligible for citizenship until her mid-thirties because of rule changes since.
Rejected for permanent residency because she was 17 instead of 18 years old upon high school graduation. Now studying medicine.
Danish husband of a F&F member denied permanent residency on a technicality.
Danish wife of an American immigrant who cannot qualify for permanent residency despite being the father of two Danish kids and living in the country for 10 years
Danish husband of an American immigrant who could not move to the country because of some missing paperwork.
Left unable to work for months on end because of slow bureaucracy that failed to process his application for a renewed work visa after nearly 10 years of working in Denmark.
Rejected for permanent residency because the authorities would not count an externship paid for by the public sector as full-time employment.
Rejected for permanent residency because the authorities did not recognize her volunteering activities at a clothing repair café as "Danish" enough
Danish husband of a F&F member denied permanent residency on a technicality.
Rejected for family reunification despite having three Danish kids because of time away from the labor market
Rejected for permanent residency because she was 17 instead of 18 years old upon high school graduation. Now studying international business.
Rejected for family reunification because the authorities claimed it mattered that her Danish father renounced citizenship when she was born.
Danish fiancee of a British immigrant who is facing deportation due to a missed filing deadline.
Rejected for permanent residency because the authorities would not accept evidence of self-employment.
Danish employer of a Trinidadian immigrant who was deported from the country.
Rejected for a work visa after divorcing from Danish spouse because income was deemed too low as a metalworker.
Famous musician who would like to pay tax and live with his wife in Denmark but faces the threat of deportation because of inability to learn Danish
Danish wife of a South African immigrant who was rejected for permanent residency.
Ineligible for permanent residency until her late twenties despite working for Danish government ministries and growing up in the country.
Rejected for Danish citizenship because of a 100 euro speeding ticket despite being born and raised in Denmark and taking a higher education.
British immigrant facing the threat of deportation because he filed paperwork for a visa extension a few days late.
South African immigrant who did not qualify for faimly reunification as a recent graduate.
Rejected for Danish citizenship because of inability to locate original high school diploma.
Permanent residency revoked due to leaving the country more than 6 months to care for sick parent.
Unable to reside in Denmark with Thai wife because of inability to produce high school diploma.
Rejected for Danish citizenship, but ultimately granted dispensation, because of a decades-old speeding ticket.
